Carl Denham (Black) needs to finish his movie and has the perfect location; Skull Island. 

But he still needs to find a leading lady. This &#039;soon-to-be-unfortunate&#039; soul is Ann Darrow 

(Watts). No one knows what they will encounter on this island and why it is so mysterious, 

but once they reach it, they will soon find out. Living on this hidden island is a giant 

gorilla and this beast now has Ann is it&#039;s grasps. Carl and Ann&#039;s new love, Jack Driscoll 

(Brody) must travel through the jungle looking for Kong and Ann, whilst avoiding all sorts 

of creatures and beasts. But Carl has another plan in mind
________________________________________________________________________

___________________________________
Trivia:Jack Black has claimed that he did not wear any make-up at all in the entire movie 

after hearing a false rumor that Clint Eastwood never wears any make-up in his movies. He 

also wore a hairpiece during filming rather than going through makeup to achieve the &#039;30s 

hairdo&#039; look.

The Times Square set was built about 20% scaled down from the original. For this and most 

other New York sets, only the first story was built in full scale. The rest of the scenes 

were added digitally. Streets were also extended using digital effects, and the number of 

pedestrians and cars were doubled or even tripled in large scenes, using the same process 

applied to the battle scenes in the Lord of the Rings films.
